intro: Valeriana chodatiana, commonly known as the mountain valerian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky soils. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Valeriana chodatiana is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
